Dear Ms. Taylor:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Stephanie S Meeuwenberg, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction, prevention; prohibited
Title restraints; elimination of restraints.
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159
Section (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
Description manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth’s behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
condition, and personal history, including any history of trauma,
and must be done in a manner consistent with the youth’s
treatment plan.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 3/16/24, youth was throwing rocks at staff. Youth was
restrained using CPI technique, but it is unclear if this was done
properly. As youth was punching staff, a staff blocked the youth,
then punched the youth in the face with a closed fist. It is unknown
if this was intentional. On 3/18/24, youth had a mark or cut on the
bottom lip as a result of the incident.
Investigation Interviews:
Vice President of Residential Treatment was interviewed on
March 19, 2024, and April 10, 2024. Vice President of
Residential Treatment said he met with Staff 2 on Monday, March
18, 2024, at which time Staff 2 first stated Youth A was not
punched but that Supervisor W was blocking Youth A’s arms, then
when asked more directly, Staff 2 stated Supervisor W punched
Youth A. Vice President of Residential Treatment said at that point
he stopped talking to Staff 2 and reported the allegations to
Michigan Department of Health and Human Services. Vice
President of Residential Treatment stated Staff 2’s verbal report
didn't match his written report. Vice President of Residential
Treatment said Staff 2 told him that he gave his written incident
report to Supervisor W, never reporting it was thrown away or that
he was directed to rewrite it by Supervisor W. Vice President of
Residential Treatment said Staff 2 has been inconsistent in his
report of the events and Staff 2’s version of the incident does not
match any other staff’s he talked to.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on March
19, 2024, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker and Law
Enforcement. Youth A had a small cut to the middle of his lower
lip and a small healing scratch on his right cheek. Youth A said the
2

cut on the middle of his lower lip was from a restraint on Saturday,
and the scratch on his cheek was from “playing around” with other
youth. Youth A said on Sunday he was restrained by Staff 2 and
Staff 4, noting Supervisor W was also present. Youth A denied any
other youth being present for the restraint. Youth A said he had
been playing basketball and was mad because he kept losing.
Youth A said when it was time to go back to the unit, he became
upset and walked off. Youth A said Staff 2 followed him and “would
not stop talking” to him so he pushed him. Youth A said Supervisor
W had been following him as well and when he saw Youth A push
Staff 2, Supervisor W walked up to him which made him feel
“threatened” so he tried to punch Supervisor W. Youth A said when
he attempted to punch Supervisor W “he had a reflex and hit me
in my mouth." Youth A said Staff 2 witnessed this occur and did
not say or do anything. Youth A said he did not feel that Supervisor
W did this on purpose and demonstrated that when he punched
forward Supervisor W’s arm went in an upward motion with a
closed fist under Youth A’s arm. Youth A said when Supervisor W
did this motion is when he hit him in the mouth with his right-hand
knuckles. Youth A said Supervisor W stated “"my bad, I didn't
mean to do that." Youth A said he had a cut on his inner lip that
was bleeding and denied any other injuries. Youth A said he was
placed in a restraint due to hitting staff by Supervisor W and Staff
4. Youth A said he was in a standing restraint with his arms back
and he was leaning forward. Youth A said he was held until he
stopped resisting and then he sat on the ground. Youth A said
Staff 3 came and talked to him. Youth A said he did not tell Staff 3
about being hit in the lip. Youth A said he went inside and took a
shower. Youth A denied Supervisor W ever hitting him previously,
again stating he did not believe Supervisor W hit him intentionally.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on March
19, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker and Law
Enforcement. Staff 1 said he was not present for the restraint with
Supervisor W however saw Youth A in the hallway after the
incident. Staff 1 said Youth A’s lower lip was bleeding and
“somewhat busted”. Staff 1 said Youth A told him that Supervisor
W hit him. Staff 1 said Supervisor Y was present and took over the
conversation to “talk it out” with Youth A. Staff 1 denied seeing any
other injuries. Staff 1 said he has never seen Supervisor W be
physically aggressive with youth.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on March
19, 2024, and via telephone on April 16, 2024, in collaboration
with MDHHS worker and Law Enforcement. Staff 2 said he was
present during the restraint on Saturday with Supervisor W. Staff 2
3

said he went to the gym and everyone was gathering their things
and leaving. Staff 2 said he noticed Youth A walk outside by
himself, stating he knew Youth A was not to be alone, so he yelled
to Staff 4 and they both followed him. Staff 2 said he asked Youth
A if he was okay, and Youth A began to shout at him about the
basketball game being unfair. Staff 2 said Youth A ended up
running around the building and towards the road. Staff 2 said
Staff 4 was trying to talk to Youth A and calm him down while he
kept his distance. Staff 2 said Youth A ended up cutting across the
grass to the front of the building and sat on the air conditioning
unit. Staff 2 said Staff 4 continued to talk to Youth A. Staff 2 said
Youth A refused to go inside and therefore Staff 4 called for
supervisor assistance. Staff 2 said Supervisor Z and Supervisor W
arrived and tried to talk with Youth A about going inside to finish
his day. Staff 2 said Youth A was using vulgar language yelling and
began to direct his anger at Supervisor W, who was also swearing
in his conversation with Youth A. Staff 2 said he was standing
about three feet away from Youth A and told him “It is okay to be
angry but there is always going to be another day” which
“triggered” Youth A and Youth A rushed towards him and pushed
him. Staff 2 said he did not say anything in response and Staff 4
and Supervisor Z immediately went into a restraint moving from
holding Youth A’s arms at his side to leaning him forward due to
him resisting. Staff 2 said this restraint lasted about a minute due
to Youth A turning towards Staff 4 and spitting on him and then
going to his knees, so he was released. Staff 2 said Youth A sat on
the ground for a minute and Staff 4, Supervisor Z, and Supervisor
W all were talking to him trying to calm him down. Staff 2 said
Youth A was still cussing and yelling at staff and said he did not
want to go inside because it was “boring”. Staff 2 said Youth A
stood up and punched with his left fist into Supervisor W’s chest.
He first stated he was not sure if Supervisor W was attempting to
block Youth A’s punch, then changed and said Supervisor W
punched Youth A with his left fist, later stating it was his right fist.
Staff 2 said it was very clear that Supervisor W punched Youth A
with a closed fist in his lip and that he saw it clearly. Staff 2 stated
he was “100% confident” in his answers and would testify under
oath that what he saw was true. Staff 2 said in training they are
taught to step aside or push the punch away, reiterating that was
not what Supervisor W did with Youth A. Staff 2 stated there was
“blood pouring out” from Youth A’s mouth and it looked “really
bad”. Staff 2 said Supervisor W punched Youth A one time. Staff 2
said Youth A then pushed Supervisor W resulting in Supervisor W
and Staff 4 placing Youth A in a restraint with his arms behind his
back and he was leaning forward. Staff 2 said Supervisor W
instructed him to take over for him so he did. Staff 2 said Youth A
4

kicked Staff 4 in the side of the leg so they moved to a standing
restraint, with Youth A’s arms by their sides and him standing
straight up, however Youth A immediately dropped to the ground
so they released him. Staff 2 said when Youth A fell to the ground
he landed on the cement and scraped his elbow which was also
bleeding. Staff 2 said Staff 4 and Supervisor Z were also present
and should have seen exactly what he saw. Staff 2 said he has
never seen any other concerns with Supervisor W and any other
youth. Staff 2 said after the restraint he wrote a four-to-five-page
incident report, explaining from start to finish what had occurred.
Staff 2 said once he was done, he gave it to Supervisor W to
review and Supervisor W threw his copy in the trash and told him
to rewrite the incident report. Staff 2 said Supervisor W told him
exactly what to write in the new incident report. Staff 2 said the
next day he was called into Residential Operations Program
Manager’s office and was told the report was not detailed enough
and he needed to rewrite it with the details of what had occurred.
Staff 2 said he rewrote the incident report to be like the first one he
had originally authored with the “whole story” and handed it back
into Residential Operations Program Manager. Staff 2 said he told
Residential Operations Program Manager that Supervisor W had
made him change his original incident report and she said “okay”.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on March
19, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker and Law
Enforcement. Staff 3 denied being present during the restraint
with Youth A on Saturday. Staff 3 said she was called over her
radio by Staff 4 due to Youth A wanting to talk to her. Staff 3 said
when she arrived, Youth A was sitting on the ground quietly. Staff 3
said Youth A told her his arm hurt and she told him she would
have him checked out. Staff 3 said she encouraged Youth A to go
back to his unit and take a shower, which he agreed to do. Staff 3
said Youth A walked back to his unit with her, sat on the bed, and
then took a shower. Staff 3 said Youth A had “a couple scrapes on
his arms” but denied seeing any blood on Youth A’s face or mouth.
Staff 3 denied Youth A telling her that Supervisor W hit him in the
mouth stating Youth A was just sitting quietly. Staff 3 said
Supervisor W was present and was texting on his cellphone at the
time. Staff 3 denied ever seeing any concerns with the way
Supervisor W interacts or treats the youth. Staff 3 said she has
never seen Supervisor W become physically aggressive with a
youth, stating all the youth are excited to see Supervisor W when
he works.
Staff 4 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on March
19, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker and Law
5

Enforcement. Staff 4 said on Saturday he was in the gym with
Youth A when he walked out without permission. Staff 4 said Youth
A was on a “two to one” meaning he had to be with two staff. Staff
4 said he was one of the staff however was unable to remember
who the second staff was that day. Staff 4 said he and Staff 2
followed Youth A out of the gym and over to the side of Clarence
Fischer Center building and Youth A sat on the air conditioning
unit. Staff 4 said Youth A’s “speed was escalated” clarifying that
Youth A was very upset yelling and cussing at staff. Staff 4 said
Supervisor W came to assist and Youth A got up and began
“swinging on everyone”, clarifying it was Staff 2, Supervisor W,
and Supervisor Z. Staff 4 said he and Supervisor W placed Youth
A in a standing restraint with him holding one arm, Supervisor W
holding the other arm, and Youth A being leaned forward. Staff 4
said Youth A dropped to the ground and therefore they released
the restraint. Staff 4 said Youth A began to calm down and asked
for Staff 3 who came and talked with him and then brought him
back to his unit. Staff 4 said once on the unit, Youth A completed
his hygiene and then went to bed. Staff 4 said he never saw
Supervisor W punch Youth A. Staff 4 said he never saw Youth A
bleeding during or after the incident. Staff 4 denied seeing any
scratches on Youth A’s face or arms, however, did state that Youth
A told him his arm was hurting so he was going to be seen by a
doctor. Staff 4 said he is unsure when Youth A was seen as he
ended up leaving shortly after the incident due to his shift being
over.
Supervisor Z was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
March 19, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker and Law
Enforcement. Supervisor Z said he responded to Youth A being
outside after gym refusing to come inside. Supervisor Z said when
he got outside Youth A was sitting on the air conditioning unit and
was visibly upset, cussing and yelling. Supervisor Z said Staff 2,
Staff 4, and Supervisor W were with Youth A attempting to talk to
him. Supervisor Z said Youth A got up and began to “swing” at
Staff 2 resulting in a team restraint with Staff 2 and Staff 4, with
Youth A’s arms being held by each staff and him being leaned
forward. Supervisor Z said Supervisor W was standing near them
and Youth A began to target Supervisor W, kicking at him while in
the restraint. Supervisor Z said Staff 2, Staff 4, and Supervisor W
continued to try to talk to Youth A throughout the restraint.
Supervisor Z said Youth A went to his knees and therefore was
released from the restraint. Supervisor Z said Youth A got up and
went towards Supervisor W “swinging wildly” and spitting on him.
Supervisor Z said Supervisor W was backing away from Youth A
and had his hands up trying to block and deflect the punches by
6

Youth A. Supervisor Z said he never saw Supervisor W swing at
Youth A or move his arms near Youth A, stating he was close
enough where he felt he would have seen if Supervisor W’s hands
hit Youth A’s face. Supervisor Z said once Youth A’s punches
began to connect with Supervisor W, Youth A was placed in
another team restraint by Staff 2 and Staff 4, each staff holding
Youth A’s arms and him being leaned forward. Supervisor Z said
Youth A again went to his knees and staff released the restraint.
Supervisor Z said after that point Youth A was not placed in any
other restraints but rather just sat on the ground requesting to talk
to Staff 3.
Supervisor W was interviewed via telephone on April 10,
2024, while MDHHS worker and Law Enforcement were
interviewing him face-to-face at the facility. Supervisor W said
on Saturday, March 16, 2024, Youth A had walked off from the
gym due to being upset regarding a basketball game. Supervisor
W said Youth A went around the building and was sitting on the air
conditioning unit. Supervisor W said Staff 2 and Staff 4 were
talking to him however Youth A “did not want to hear it”. Supervisor
W said he and Supervisor Z both came for assistance. Supervisor
W said Staff 2 was trying to remind Youth A that they were going to
do a movie after showers and Youth A responded telling Staff 2 to
“shut up or he would beat his ass” and then stood up and pushed
Staff 2. Supervisor W said he had been standing by Staff 2 and he
put his hands up and asked Youth A what he was doing, and Youth
A turned and started to punch him in the chest. Supervisor W said
he reached for Youth A’s hand to place him in a standing restraint
due to the assault and when he did Youth A pulled his fist back
again and he said he stepped back, so he did not get hit.
Supervisor W said Supervisor Z and Staff 4 then placed Youth A in
a standing restraint with Youth A’s arms at their sides. Supervisor
W said Youth A was able to get out of the restraint, so he took
ahold of Youth A’s right hand to prevent him from hitting
Supervisor Z. Supervisor W said he instructed Staff 2 to relieve
him, and Staff 2 and Staff 4 held Youth A in the standing restraint.
Supervisor W said the restraint was brief as Youth A dropped to
the ground so they released him. Supervisor W said Youth A then
grabbed a handful of rocks and started to throw them which led to
another standing restraint, this time with Staff 2 and Staff 4 holding
his arms and leaning him forward over their legs. Supervisor W
said Youth A dropped to the ground again and they released him.
Supervisor W said when Staff 2 and Staff 4 released Youth A he
fell forward and said that he hurt his arm. Supervisor W said he
asked Youth A if he wanted medical attention and Youth A declined
but asked to talk to Staff 3. Supervisor W said Staff 3 came and
7

talked to Youth A and he got up and went into the unit. Supervisor
W denied ever punching Youth A. Supervisor W denied it being
possible that he came in any contact with Youth A’s face or mouth.
Supervisor W said he does not know how Youth A’s lip was
bleeding, stating maybe Youth A possibly hitting himself or biting
his lip. Supervisor W said Youth A’s lip was not gushing blood but
similar to an injury one might getting playing basketball or
something of that nature where there is a little blood mixed with
saliva. Supervisor W said no staff turned in written statements to
him the night of the incident. Supervisor W said he and Staff 2
completed incident reports for the restraints that night prior to
leaving their shift. Supervisor W said Staff 2 completed his
incident report and gave it to him and he read it over and put it in
the yellow folder where all reports are placed. Supervisor W
denied throwing away any incident reports. Supervisor W denied
helping Staff 2 write his incident report or telling Staff 2 what to
say in the incident report. Supervisor W denied seeing an incident
report that stated he punched Youth A in the face.
Residential Operations Program Manager was interviewed
face-to-face at the facility on April 10, 2024, in collaboration
with MDHHS worker and Law Enforcement. Residential
Operations Program Manager said she was informed by Vice
President of Residential Treatment that Staff 2’s verbal statement
regarding the restraint from March 16, 2024, did not match the
incident report he authored. Residential Operations Program
Manager met with Staff 2 and told him to be honest in his report
and rewrite it with complete details of what he saw occur during
the restraint. Residential Operations Program Manager said Staff
2 wrote the second incident report that was provided to this
consultant.
Documents Reviewed:
• Youth A’s Incident Reports:
o Internal Behavior Notification dated March 16, 2024,
at 7:46am. Youth A hit another youth at breakfast.
o Internal Behavior Notification dated March 16, 2024,
at 8:01am. Youth A intervened in another youth’s
restraint, then attempted to AWOL from the building
however was prevented by staff.
o Internal Behavior Notification dated March 16, 2024,
at 10:00am. Youth A demanded to go to the gym and
when told no, threw furniture around the milieu and
left the unit wandering around campus as staff
followed and got him to return to the unit.
8

o Internal Behavior Notification dated March 16, 2024,
at 2:15pm. Youth A became verbally aggressive with
staff stating, “they are bitches, and he hopes their
kids die and he’s going to find a reason to have them
put on administrative leave”. Youth A was making
these statements as staff were following him as he
was walking off site.
o MiSACWIS Incident Report 177470231 dated March
16, 2024, at 3:00pm. Youth A was running around
campus without permission and Staff 4 and Staff 6
were following him to ensure safety. Youth A began
to push both staff and therefore was placed in a low-
level team control restraint by Staff 4 and Staff 6.
The restraint lasted one minute, Youth A dropped to
the ground, and he was released.
o MiSACWIS Incident Report 177460230 dated March
16, 2024, at 3:02pm. Youth A had just been released
from the prior restraint and got up and charged at
staff, pushing and punching them. Staff 4 and Staff 6
placed Youth A in a high team control restraint from
3:02-3:03pm. Youth A was clam and returned to the
unit.
o MiSACWIS Incident Report 177480229 dated March
16, 2024, at 7:40pm. The incident report was
authored by Supervisor W regarding the incident
under investigation. The incident report is consistent
with Supervisor W’s interview, with the exception of
the incident report stating, “Youth A bit his lip and
had a little cut on his lip”. The MiSACWIS incident
report is the exact same as the internal incident
report Supervisor W authored.
o Internal Incident Reports dated March 16, 2024, at
7:40pm written by Staff 2 were reviewed:
▪ First Incident Report written states “[Youth A]
was placed in a restraint for being physically
aggressive with staff, and had a full hand of
rocks. [Youth A] was placed in a CPI high
technique control. Client continued to fight
restraint and then dropped to the ground. He
was then released at the time he fell to the
ground and fell on his left side hurting his
elbow.” Under the incident report question
about injury, Staff 2 wrote “bleeding lip/left
elbow”.
▪ Second Incident Report written is three pages
in length, with very specific details and is
9

consistent with his interview. This incident
report specifically states, “[Youth A] punched
[Supervisor W] in the chest 3 times.
[Supervisor W] instead of him blocking [Youth
A’s] punches or stepping away from [Youth A]
which he could have no problem. [Supervisor
W] instead punched [Youth A] in the mouth
causing [Youth A] to bleed.”
• Youth A’s Medical Records from Covenant Med Express
were reviewed. Youth A was seen on March 18, 2024, for a
“lip laceration”. The physical exam notes: "A tooth shaped
puncture wound is present centrally on the lower lip. Wound
edges are well approximated without erythema, warmth, or
active drainage. No palpable foreign bodies noted."
• Staff 1 witness statement dated March 16, 2024. The
statement is consistent with Staff 1’s interview.
• Staff 4’s witness statement dated March 16, 2024. The
statement is consistent with Staff 4’s interview.
• Supervisor Z’s witness statement dated March 16, 2024.
The statement is consistent with Supervisor Z’s interview.
• Supervisor W’s personnel file: Supervisor W completed
Crisis Prevention Intervention training on December 5,
2023. There were 6 disciplinary actions located in his file no
related to interactions with youth.
Video Review:
A review of video footage of March 16, 2024, occurred on March
19, 2024. During this review of different camera’s, it was verified
that the restraint was outside of camera view and no footage was
able to be viewed.
Tour Observation:
A tour of the area where Youth A was on March 16, 2024, was
viewed on March 19, 2024. The area has air conditioning units
surrounded by grass. There is a sidewalk next to the area
however the cameras do not point in that direction.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as there was not enough
information to support a rule violation as Staff 4, Supervisor Z, and
Supervisor W denied Supervisor W hitting Youth A. Youth A
stated he did not feel Supervisor W hit him intentionally but rather
out of reaction to him punching him. Staff 2 adamantly reports
Supervisor W punched Youth A in the face intentionally. The
cause of the injury to Youth A’s lip is unable to be determined.
There were no videos of the incident.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
10

Rule Code Emergency restraint
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4160
Section (1) The use of emergency restraint as a lifesaving response for a
Description youth will be limited to:
(a) An emergency response to protect the youth or others from
an unanticipated or severely aggressive behavior that places the
youth or others at serious threat of violence or injury if no
immediate intervention occurs.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation The facility completed an unwarranted restraint.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on March
19, 2024, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker and Law
Enforcement. During the interview, Youth A disclosed concerns
about another restraint with Supervisor Y. Youth A said the
Sunday after the incident with Supervisor W, he walked off his unit
around lunchtime and was restrained by Supervisor Y in the
hallway by unit 1 and unit 2. Youth A said Supervisor Y grabbed
him and put him in a standing restraint against the wall and he
was resisting and spit on Supervisor Y. Youth A said Supervisor Y
then put his elbow on the left side of Youth A’s face for about a
minute stating “you are not doing this on my shift”. Youth A said
Supervisor Y’s elbow made his nose bleed and his face and neck
were hurting. Youth A then changed the sequence of events
saying Supervisor Y pulled him under the camera and he fell to his
knees and then to his butt. Youth A said when he dropped to his
butt he moved and was then on his stomach flat on the ground
and Supervisor Y using one arm to hold his hands behind his back
and his other elbow was in the left side of Youth A’s face. During
the interview Youth A said he was on his stomach for about 30
seconds then later stated it was about two minutes. Youth A
denied having difficulty breathing. Youth A said he stood up and
Supervisor Y was standing above him, so he tried to “fight”
Supervisor Y and was placed in another standing restraint by
Supervisor Y. Youth A said during the restraint Supervisor Y told
him if he “told then he will press charges on [Youth A] for hitting
him”. Youth A said he thought Staff 4 saw Supervisor Y’s elbow in
his face. Youth A said Staff 5 then walked up and did not see
Supervisor Y’s elbow on his face but did see his nose bleeding.
Youth A said Staff 5 gave him paper towel for his nose. Youth A
denied getting any medical treatment for his nose. Youth A said
he wanted to call Child Protective Services(CPS) and Supervisor
Y told him he would press charges on him if he did. Youth A said
11

he talked to Residential Operations Program Manager, and she
said he could call CPS. Youth A said Supervisor Y then said if he
wanted to call CPS, he had to do it in front of him, so Youth A
decided not to call CPS.
Staff 4 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on March
19, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker and Law
Enforcement. Staff 4 said he was present on Sunday with Youth A
was restrained by Supervisor Y. Staff 4 said because Youth A is on
a two to one it is a requirement that Youth A is placed in an
"immediate restraint" if he pushes through staff or becomes
unsafe. Staff 4 said that day Youth A ran off the unit and was
punching staff, spitting on staff, and trying to push past staff in the
hallway. Staff 4 said Youth A had punched him in the head and hit
Supervisor Y and therefore he was placed in a standing restraint
with his arms behind him and his body bent forward. Staff 4 said
Youth A dropped to his knees and he and Supervisor Y released
Youth A. Staff 4 denied Youth A being restrained on the ground at
any point. Staff 4 said he did not see Supervisor Y have any
physical contact with Youth A outside of the standing restraint,
denying ever seeing Supervisor Y’s elbow in Youth A's face. Staff
4 said Youth A calmed down and eventually went to lunch. Staff 4
denied any other youth being present, and stated another staff did
come into the hallway at the end of the restraint however he was
unsure of that staff’s name. Staff 4 said he had heard that Youth A
wanted to call CPS however he is unaware if he did or not.
Staff 5 was called on April 9, 2024, and April 16, 2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS however he did not answer his
phone. Staff 5 did call MDHHS worker on April 17, 2024, and was
interviewed via telephone. Staff 5 said he was not present for the
whole restraint with Youth A by Supervisor Y on March 17, 2024,
however arrived at the end. Staff 5 said when he arrived Youth A
and Supervisor Y were both standing, noting Supervisor Y was not
restraining Youth A. Staff 5 said Supervisor Y asked Staff 5 to
switch with him as Youth A was targeting him and he felt if another
staff stepped in it may help Youth A calm down. Staff 5 said he
tried to talk to Youth A however Youth A became upset and tried to
go after Supervisor Y so he and Staff 4 placed Youth A in a
standing restraint. Staff 5 said the restraint was brief as Youth A
dropped to the ground and they released him. Staff 5 said Youth A
continued to yell and go after Supervisor Y stating he was going to
hit him. Staff 5 said Youth A attempted to go towards Supervisor Y,
he stepped in front of him and said his name repeatedly until
Youth A sat down and calmed down. Staff 5 said he never saw
Supervisor Y’s elbow make contact with Youth A. Staff 5 said
12

Youth A’s nose was bleeding when he arrived, stating he does not
know what caused this. Staff 5 said Youth A did not tell him what
happened to his nose. Staff 5 said he believed Youth A made a
comment about calling CPS, however he is unaware if Youth A
did, and he did not have anything to do with that.
Supervisor Y was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
April 10, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker and Law
Enforcement. Supervisor Y said he was involved in a restraint
with Youth A in the hallway on a weekend around 9pm, later in the
interview he recalled it was actually around 1:30pm. Supervisor Y
said Youth A had “bolted off the unit” and was heading outside.
Supervisor Y said he was in the supervisor’s office when he came
to assist, also calling Staff 5 for assistance. Supervisor Y said Staff
4 was Youth A’s one to one staff that day and had followed him
into the hallway. Supervisor Y said he and Staff 4 were trying to
talk with Youth A and Youth A stated, “fuck this shit” and continued
to attempt to push past him and Staff 4 to get outside. Supervisor
Y said he could not allow Youth A outside as he is on a safety plan
so he and Staff 4 placed Youth A in a restraint. Supervisor Y said
Youth A’s arms were held at his side as he and Staff 4 tried to
calm him down however Youth A continues to struggle against the
hold, spit in Supervisor Y’s face and got his arm free and hit him “a
couple of times”. Supervisor Y said he had become Youth A’s
target so he switched out with Staff 5 upon his arrival. Supervisor
Y denied ever being alone with Youth A during the restraint, stating
Staff 4 was the second staff present throughout the entire incident.
Supervisor Y denied ever having his elbow on Youth A’s face or
head. Supervisor Y demonstrated the hold with Youth A being on
his side and him using his right hand to hold Youth A’s right wrist
and his left hand open in front of his own face to block Youth A’s
spit from hitting him. Supervisor Y denied the possibility of his
elbow being in Youth A’s face stating, “it wouldn’t be possible
because of [Youth A’s] height compared to mine”. Supervisor Y
said the restraint was standing the entire time and denied ever
restraining him on the floor. Supervisor Y denied any point during
the restraint when Youth A’s head was pressed against the wall.
Supervisor Y said the restraint ended when Staff 5 arrived and
took over and was able to calm Youth A down. Supervisor Y said
Youth A had been bleeding the day before and he believed
reopened the wound from his mouth during the restraint.
Supervisor Y said it wasn’t until Youth A sat down after the
restraint that he noticed any blood. Supervisor Y said he asked
Youth A what caused his bleeding and Youth A told him it was from
an injury the day prior. Supervisor Y said Youth A then stated
“yeah, that’s why I want to call CPS”. Supervisor Y said Youth A
13

then changed his mind and said he did not want to call CPS.
Supervisor Y denied ever telling Youth A he was not allowed to call
CPS.
Supervisor X was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
April 10, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker.
Supervisor X said she was not present when Youth A was
restrained by Supervisor Y, however when she came into her shift
that afternoon Youth A was in the office telling Supervisor Y he did
not want to call CPS. Supervisor X said Youth A and Supervisor Y
were on the phone with someone, however she did not know who.
Supervisor X said Youth A then went back to the unit. Supervisor X
denied seeing Youth A bleeding while in the office.
Residential Operations Program Manager was interviewed
face-to-face at the facility on April 10, 2024, in collaboration
with MDHHS worker and Law Enforcement. Residential
Operations Program Manager said she received a call from Staff 5
that Youth A wanted to call CPS on March 17, 2024. Residential
Operations Program Manager said she told Staff 5 that was fine
as soon as he was clam enough to be on the phone. Residential
Operations Program Manager said she later received a text that
Youth A had changed his mind and did not want to call CPS.
Residential Operations Program Manager said the youth are
always allowed to call CPS; they just direct staff to ensure the
youth is calm enough to make the phone call.
Documents Reviewed:
• Supervisor Y’s personnel file: There was one discipline on
November 7, 2022, for a medication error. Supervisor Y
completed Crisis Prevention Intervention training on April
14, 2023, and December 4, 2023.
• Staff statements regarding Youth A’s request to call CPS:
o Supervisor X statement dated March 17, 2024,
reported she witnessed Youth A tell staff he did not
want to call CPS and wanted to return to his unit.
o Staff 4 statement dated March 17, 2024, at 2:30pm.
Staff 4 stated Youth A told him he did not want to call
CPS and wanted to go back to his unit.
o Staff 6 statement dated March 17, 2024, at 2:30pm.
Staff 6 stated Youth A told him he did not want to call
CPS and wanted to go back to his unit.
o Staff 7 statement dated March 17, 2024, at 2:30pm.
Staff 7 stated he heard Youth A state he did not want
to call CPS and wanted to go back to his unit.
14

o Supervisor Y statement dated March 17, 2024, at
2:30pm. Supervisor Y stated Youth A told him and
other youth care workers he did not want to call CPS
and wanted to go back to his unit and play games.
• Youth A’s Incident Reports:
o MiSACWIS Incident Report 177470232 dated March
17, 2024, at 1:30pm. The incident report is authored
by Staff 4 and is consistent with his interview.
o MiSACWIS Incident Report 177460231 dated March
17, 2024, at 1:33pm. The incident report is authored
by Supervisor Y and is consistent with his interview.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of March 17, 2024, hallway between unit 1 and
unit 2 was reviewed on April 12, 2024. Youth A is seen running
out of a unit into the hallway with Staff 4 chasing him. Staff 4 and
Youth A go off camera briefly, once back on camera Staff 4 has
Youth A in a restraint, Staff 4 is standing behind Youth A with his
arms under Youth A’s armpits. Supervisor Y walks out of a unit and
down the hallway to Staff 4 and Youth A. Staff 4 and Youth A are
out of camera view and once back on camera Youth A is in a
restraint with Supervisor Y holding his left arm, Staff 4 holding his
right arm and he is bent over at the waist. Youth A is seen going to
his knees and Supervisor Y and Staff 4 release the restraint. Youth
A stands up and Supervisor Y immediately engages in a restraint
and attempts to get behind Youth A while he is moving his arms
around and moving away from Supervisor Y. Staff 4 is walking
towards Supervisor Y and Youth A as they all go off camera view,
moving under the camera. Staff 4’s head and part of his upper
body comes on and off camera a few times however there is no
view of the restraint occurring. Staff 5 is seen walking out of a unit
and down the hallway to where Staff 4 and Supervisor Y are under
the camera with Youth A. Supervisor Y and Staff 4 are seen
stepping away from the situation as Staff 5 walks under the
camera view. Supervisor Y and Staff 4 are seen on camera
standing away but looking towards what is believed to be Youth A
and Staff 5. Staff 5 and Staff 4 are seen walking with Youth A
through the doorway, Youth A is no longer in a restraint.
Supervisor Y walks down the hallway in the opposite direction.
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance as Supervisor Y engaged
in an unwarranted restraint with Youth A in the hallway on March
17, 2024. The video review showed Staff 4 and Supervisor Y
release a restraint with Youth A as he dropped to his knees, and
upon Youth A standing up Supervisor Y engages in an
15

unwarranted restraint as Youth A was not exhibiting any behaviors
at that time that required a physical intervention.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
Technical assistance was offered in the following areas:
• All safety plans should be documented for staff to review
and follow.
• Safety plans cannot provide a directive to restrain youth.
All restraints must be assessed in the moment and not as
a standard safety precaution.
• Staff should be reminded that spitting cannot be the sole
reason for restraint.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

sir_summary.summary: A youth facility was investigated after allegations that a supervisor (Supervisor W) punched a youth (Youth A) in the face during a restraint, causing a lip injury. The report found the evidence conflicting and could not substantiate that specific rule violation. However, the investigation substantiated two other violations: Supervisor Y performed an unwarranted restraint on the same youth the next day, and Staff 2, who witnessed the alleged punch, failed to report it to authorities as required by child protection law. The facility is culpable for the documented failures in restraint protocol and mandated reporting.
